statements: SELECT test_id, test_name, start_date, end_date, variant_a, variant_b FROM ab_tests;
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date, variant_a FROM ab_tests WHERE test_id = '12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789abc';
SELECT * FROM ab_tests WHERE content_element LIKE '%important%';
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date, variant_a, variant_b FROM ab_tests ORDER BY start_date DESC, test_name ASC;
SELECT test_name, end_date, variant_a FROM ab_tests WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT test_id, test_name, start_date FROM ab_tests ORDER BY start_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM ab_tests WHERE end_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT test_id, test_name, content_element FROM ab_tests WHERE test_name LIKE '%example%';
SELECT test_id, test_name, variant_a, variant_b FROM ab_tests WHERE variant_a IS NOT NULL AND variant_b IS NOT NULL;
SELECT test_id, test_name, start_date, end_date FROM ab_tests WHERE start_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01';
SELECT * FROM A/B_test_results;
SELECT test_name, test_variant FROM A/B_test_results WHERE test_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT test_name, test_variant FROM A/B_test_results ORDER BY test_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM A/B_test_sessions WHERE conversion_event = TRUE;
SELECT test_name, test_date FROM A/B_test_results WHERE test_variant = 'B' ORDER BY test_date ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM A/B_test_results WHERE test_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT test_name, test_variant, test_date FROM A/B_test_results WHERE test_variant = 'Control' ORDER BY test_date DESC;

SELECT session_id, test_name, session_start AS start_time, session_end AS end_time FROM A/B_test_sessions INNER JOIN A/B_test_results ON A/B_test_sessions.test_id = A/B_test_results.test_id WHERE conversion_event = TRUE;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(session_id) AS session_count FROM A/B_test_sessions GROUP BY user_id HAVING COUNT(session_id) > 1;
SELECT * FROM A/B_test_results ORDER BY test_variant, test_date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM ab_tests;
SELECT test_id, test_name, status FROM ab_tests WHERE test_id = 1;
SELECT DISTINCT test_name FROM ab_tests ORDER BY test_name ASC;
SELECT test_id, variation_id, conversion_rate FROM test_results WHERE conversion_rate > 3.00;
SELECT * FROM test_variations WHERE is_winner = TRUE ORDER BY variation_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ab_tests;
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date FROM ab_tests WHERE status = 'ongoing';
SELECT test_id, test_name, start_date, end_date FROM ab_tests WHERE start_date >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY test_id DESC;

SELECT tr.test_id, tv.variation_name, tr.conversion_rate FROM test_results tr JOIN test_variations tv ON tr.variation_id = tv.variation_id WHERE tr.conversion_rate >= 0.5 ORDER BY tr.test_id, tv.variation_id;
SELECT tr.test_id, COUNT(tr.variation_id) AS num_variations FROM test_results tr GROUP BY tr.test_id HAVING COUNT(tr.variation_id) > 1;
SELECT * FROM ContentElements;
SELECT element_name, element_type FROM ContentElements ORDER BY element_type ASC;
SELECT content_id, element_name FROM ContentElements WHERE element_type = 'Image';
SELECT * FROM ABTests WHERE status = 'Active';
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date FROM ABTests WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM ContentElements WHERE element_type = 'image' ORDER BY content_id DESC;
SELECT element_name, element_type FROM ContentElements WHERE content_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_tests FROM ABTests WHERE status = 'active';
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date FROM ABTests WHERE status = 'completed' AND end_date < '2022-01-01';

SELECT TR.result_id, TR.test_id, TR.content_id, TP.group_name FROM TestResults AS TR JOIN TestParticipants AS TP ON TR.test_id = TP.test_id AND TR.content_id = TP.content_id ORDER BY TR.result_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM A/B_Tests;
SELECT test_name, start_date, end_date FROM A/B_Tests WHERE status='active';
SELECT test_name, test_id FROM A/B_Tests WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Test_Variants WHERE variant_name='Control';
SELECT variant_id, test_id FROM Test_Variants WHERE test_id=5;
SELECT * FROM A/B_Tests
SELECT test_id, test_name, start_date, end_date, status FROM A/B_Tests ORDER BY start_date DESC
SELECT test_name, COUNT(*) AS total_tests FROM A/B_Tests GROUP BY test_name

SELECT test_name, variant_name, user_id, conversion FROM A/B_Tests JOIN Test_Variants ON A/B_Tests.test_id = Test_Variants.test_id JOIN Test_Results ON Test_Variants.variant_id = Test_Results.variant_id WHERE A/B_Tests.status = 'Active'
SELECT element_name, element_type FROM Content_Elements WHERE element_type LIKE '%article%'
